newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Dhaka stocks seen rising in selective trading.
newsitem.headline: Dhaka stocks seen rising in selective trading.

text.p: Shares on the Dhaka Stock Exchange are likely to rise on Sunday with buying concentrated on blue chips in the food and cement sectors, brokers said.
"Share prices are likely to rise as there will be buying pressure from small investors for select blue chips," said Redwanul Islam of Dastagir Mohammad Adil & Co.
Chittagong Cement, Amam Sea Food Industries and Singer Bangladesh were likely to be in demand, he added.
Brokers also expect continued support from the state-owned institutional investor, Investment Corporation of Bangladesh.
"Investors will be cautious in making fresh commitments," broker Moshtaque Ahmed said.
"They will not jostle like in the recent past. Euphoric trading is not healthy for the market."
The DSE all share price index closed 17.4 points, or 1.5 percent, higher at 1,174.19 on turnover of 161 million taka on Saturday.
